TextView.android:text: Starting Position: \n- Adjust the bench to a 60-degree angle. Sit on the bench with your back against the incline, ensuring your feet are firmly planted on the ground. \n- Hold a dumbbell in each hand, with your palms facing forward and elbows bent at about 90 degrees, so the dumbbells are at shoulder height.

Engage your core muscles to stabilize your torso. \n- Keep your chest up and your back against the bench throughout the exercise. \n- Arch your back slightly on the bench, making sure to push your upper back against the bench with your feet to maintain tightness along your body.

Lift: 
- Take a deep breath and brace your core. 
- Press the dumbbells overhead by extending your arms fully. Push the dumbbells upward in a controlled manner, maintaining stability throughout your core and upper body. 
- As you lift, ensure the dumbbells move directly above your head, following a straight path. 
- Lowering: 
- Slowly lower the dumbbells so they almost touch your shoulders. Control the descent.
